embeds.title: Calendar of Harptos
embeds.description: 3rd day of Eleasis (*Highsun*), 1481

footer.text: !weather list to see supported biomes and commands

messages.content: Pinned a message.
Pinned a message.

embeds.description:
Each of you wakens bright and early, mindful of Geoffrey's warning that the better jobs tend to get claimed quickly by other adventurers.  Making your way (with some difficulty) back to the entrance of The Sword, you settle up with Lyla (a mere 3sp each, with the adventurer discount) and head outside to meet your new companions.

The weather is fairer today, the clouds slowly spreading to allow bits of sun to come through.  It's a welcome change being able to see the coastal down in proper daylight.  The four of you take a moment to breath in the clear coastal air as you stand just outside The Sword's entrance.

_As Cain exits the Inn, he hands Lyla the 3sp in payment for the room and then slides another 3sp without saying a word, hoping she'll remember what he asked her the night before.

He then steps out, hood donned, in search for Rowan._

_Storm of Fire wakes up feeling more refreshed than he has been since leaving Port Nyanzaru. Eager to see what the day will offer, he dressing into his now dry travelling clothes and packs his bags. Strapping his Tome on his bag and looping his Lute over his cloak, he sets off for the front desk. Greeting Lyla and having a quick conversation of the morning, he pays her and heads out the door. He looks around to see who else has made it up this morning._

Lyla takes the extra coins with a nod, and asks no further questions.

As each of you emerges from The Sword in turn, Rowan greets you with a nod, already taking in the morning sun, cigar hanging loosely from the side of his mouth.
"Mornin', I trust you all are well rested and eager to get a look at the job postings. Since The Sword doesn't serve brekkie we can get food supplies after the job board, if that suits yeh."
"_Govath inhales deeply and stretches his back, causing multiple loud cracking noises_.  Job board sounds good to me.  Hey Cain glad to see you made it out of that inn despite the maze of halls."

*Storm stretches in the brief moment of sun before a covers it again.*

"Food after the job posting sounds like a smart idea. It would be good to get the first choice at the jobs the Lance are offering. Let us see your guidance in action!"

*He motions for Rowan to lead the way.*

"Su'tali to you Cain, it is good to see you this morning. You did miss out on good action at the tavern last night though. This one did have slight trouble finding the room last night. A wrong door may have been opened to a fully naked Half-Elf sleeping. It was...unpleasant."

"Thanks", he says to the dwarf, "Govath was it?"

Turning to the tabaxi, "It's rare to see your kind this way. I've only ever met one other in my travels. What's _your_ nickname?"

"And sorry for not joining everyone last night, I get headaches when the weather is less than pleasant."
The four of you now together, Rowan begins to lead the way, heading to the North end of town as your conversation continues.
"That is indeed my name.  Headaches eh, my arthritis just acts up a bit. _Govath says to Cain as walking._"

"Ah very nice, what was the other's name and of what clan if you can recall? You can call this one Storm. Or Fire. Or Red Eyes, which is my more commonly used bard name. Or just Red. Or Eyes. Or whatever pleases you. I believe Guide Rowan wishes to call me...Cat."

"Hm, he never spoke of his home. His name was Glittering Pond, and we met and travelled together on a ship a few years ago."

Cain says as he follows Rowan towards the jobs board.

"Oh that is interesting. I hope Glittering Pond gave a good impression of my kind."

*Turning to Rowan he adds...*

"Guide Rowan, once we are done at the job postings, perhaps you can show us the way to Coster and Wynn's Wares. This one may need a few more things before we embark on our task."
"If the job allows for the time, certainly. I reckon we'll be out of this town before noon."
"Fear not, shopping is not a big interest of mine. I prefer a quick in-and-out."

Adjusting his heavy hood, Cain says, "I'm not a big shopper myself", as he quietly taps his nearly empty coin purse.

"The sooner we're on the road, the better."

Rowan leads the party back past the High Tower of Thalivar, and eventually you pass through the town square once more.  You see Captain Reynolds and Geoffrey pinning back the flap of the large tent, preparing to accept the day's wave of fresh adventurers.

Continuing on past the southern gate (which is no gate at all, really, but an opening in the palisade which leads to the High Road and, eventually, to the Mere of Dead Men), you find that the town is quiet at this hour of the morning.  Few people roam the streets, though you catch glimpses of shopkeepers beginning their opening routines and an occasional carriage passes by.  Looking around, you could almost forget about the threat which currently looms over the land, if it weren't the reason you were here to begin with.

In time, you come upon the barracks.  It would appear you are the first adventurers to arrive - in fact, the large wooden board outside of the well-fortified stone building doesn't seem to have anything posted to it yet.  Inquiring with the two guards standing duty by the entrance, you are informed that the day's postings will be up momentarily, and that you are welcome to wait.

Just as you settle in, you notice five figures approaching from the opposite direction you came from.  The woman in front is toying with a small flame in her hand.
"Well well well, what have we here?"
Behind her, an older Half-Orc scratches his beer-belly as he eyes you up and down
"Look's ta me like a buncha green 'venturers.  Like fresh li'l Orclings slurpin' at their mama's teat."
A thuggish man steps forward from the group, brandishing a large mace.  He speaks through gritted teeth as his hand slowly moves toward the hilt.
"This gonna be a problem?  Maybe we should..."
"Now now, Jabarl, you can't just go about crushing the skull of every adventurer we come across.  Besides, do they really look like a threat?"

A muscular woman with long, black hair and piercing blue eyes stares at you all with something between a smirk and a scowl.  She towers over the others, easily over seven feet tall.  By her side is another silent companion, dressed in hooded black clothes and absentmindedly twirling an arrow in his hand.

*Rowan crosses his arms and blows a large cloud from his nose.* 

"If yeh fine folks can see, we have been waiting here upon witness of the Lances," *gesturing to the two guards.* "and since I don't know yeh, I doubt you know me. Wouldn't be wise to start something righ' off the bat with such an unknown element dontcha reckon? Green would be the proper word...."

*Storm rolls his eyes at the half-orcs remarks.*

"Half-orc, do you kiss your mother with that mouth? I think I saw her head mounted at The Orc's Tusk. I'm sure you know the place quite well with an ale-packed belly as big as yours."
_Cain smiles beneath his hood. It appears that Govath and Storm are both comedians._

"_Govath let's out a long sigh and slowly shakes his head._ Look fellas I enjoy bloodying my knuckles on strangers faces as much as the next dwarf, but none of us came here with the intention of fighting for a job.  As with all job boards, first come first serve has served for longer than any of us have been alive.  And as my companion has pointed out we were here first."
At this, the hooded figure speaks up - his accent hints at nobility and his tone drips with quiet arrogance.
""You see, Jabarl?  Their only concern is the quality of errand upon which they are sent.  They are little more than lapdogs in search of their next meal.""
""HA!  You insult dogs by comparing 'em to these mewlin' kittens, Dobin.  They could only aspire to be half as majestic, as beautiful, as...""

""We get it, Brakkis, you like dogs. 

Listen, you pile of slag - you're welcome to choose whatever job you like.  But if you have any designs on taking the Dragon's hoard for yourselves, you'd better lay them to rest.  That treasure belongs to the Stone-Cold Reavers, and you better believe we'll put down any runts that get in our way.""

embeds.title: Brakkis Elspaar
embeds.description: ""Syleen's right, younglings.  That hoard is my retirement plan.  I've been in this line o' work fer too long.  It's time to settle down, buy a house, get myself a few dogs...""
Brakkis is interrupted by his companions' loud groans and rolling eyes.  He decides to leave it at that.

"Don't want to speak on behalf of everyone here.  But here's my proposal.  If there is a posting to go find and kill the dragon we will hand it over to you.  However, if there is no dragon hunting going on today we get first choice of the jobs."

*Rowan's attention seems to be on the large silent woman, and his face flushes a scarlet red.* 

"Y-yeh see, we can all be ami-amica....amicable." *His eyes dart to t ground and he tips his hat down lower over his eyes.*

embeds.title: Cain Vance makes an Insight check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (**20**) + 2 = `22`
*From beneath his hood, Cain watches the engagement, and Rowan's reaction to seeing who the others call Syleen. Does he know her?*
Syleen tilts her head to one side and looks at Rowan, grin on her face and eyes slightly narrowed.

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description: "Something wrong with your friend there, Dwarf?  He seems to have suddenly developed a stutter."

embeds.title: Dobin Noreth
embeds.description: "The proposal is fine.  Syleen, let's just wait over there until this lot has chosen their task."

Syleen nods, and the group begins moving a short distance away to talk amongst themselves.  All except the giant woman, whose icy eyes stay locked on you all with heartless ferocity.  You get the impression that in your short conversation, she has already dreamed up 50 ways to tear you all limb-from-limb.

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description: "Runa!  Let's go!"

embeds.title: Runa Vokdotter
embeds.description: "Hmph."
Finally, she turns to join her companions, leaving the four of you alone and out of earshot once more.
_Waiting for the group to leave, Cain eventually turns to Rowan and casually asks_, "Runa huh? Do you know her, she's a tough looking one."
*Rowan stares as Runa walks away towards her group. He mutters under his breath,* "blast it!" *suddenly noticing all eyes on him, "uh, someone say something?"
"Cain was just asking if you knew that large one"
"Oh, uh, nahhhh. Never seen'er." *He coughs and clears his throat.* "So they want that dragon you boys been talking about. What're ya gonna do about that?"
"_Giving the stone-cold reavers an appraising eye over._  I assume if they do run into the dragon it may end up more bones for our boy storm here to sort through."
"I reckon you need the dragon alive to get its breath on that hammer a'yours."

"Well I suppose if they do manage to kill the dragon I'll just have to start listening for news of another one.  And anyway the captain seemed to laugh when the dragon came up in yesterday's registration making it seem the dragon is hard to locate."

*Storm eyes each of the members of the Stone-Cold Reavers, already coming up with a tune to sing in taverns about their untimely demise.*

"I would not waste precious paper in my Tome to document *their* bones. I would rather use the space for rat bones. Govath makes a good point. The Lances do not seem to know the dragon whereabouts nor keen on hunting it right now. It seems they have more pressing tasks for groups such as ours. But this one suspects they will cause us trouble..."

*Turning to Rowan, he adds...*

"If the guide Rowan knows something about them, perhaps this knowledge would be useful in keeping one step ahead of them."

*Rowan takes off his hat and hits it against his leg as if to get the dust off, the colour on his human face has returned to the normal pallor.* "I never heard of the Stone-Cold Reavers. Means they either not from around here, or they jus' as new as our little crew."

About this time, a young squire emerges from the door to the barracks.  In one hand, he holds several small pieces of parchment - in the other, a hammer.  Between his teeth are a few long nails.  He scurries over to the wooden board and hastily hammers up three posts, then scurries back inside.

"Well I suppose they do not matter for now. Let us see what the day has in store for us."

*Storm saunters over to the board once the squire is done posting the job notices.*
Upon the board, you read the following three requests upon the pieces of parchment:

"Dwarf prospectors have uncovered ancient Dwarven ruins in the mountains east of here, and have been been working an archaeological dig seeking treasures and relics.  They need to be warned that a White Dragon has been sighted in the area.  Take the warning to them and report to Captain Reynolds for a reward of 50gp."

"A clan of reclusive Rock Gnomes resides in a small network of caves at the southern base of the mountains.  The Gnomes of Gnomengarde are known for their magical inventions, and they might have something which would help in the defence against the Dragon.  Get whatever you can from them.  Captain Reynolds will grant a reward of 50gp per item turned over to the Lances."

"An acolyte of Chauntea named Adabra Gwynn serves as midwife for both the town of Leilon and the small settlement of Phandalin.  As such, she lives by herself in a stone windmill on the side of a hill situated between both locations.  With reports of Dragon sightings becoming more common, it's not safe for her to be alone.  Urge Adabra to return with you to Leilon until this matter passes.  Upon her safe arrival, you may collect a reward of 25gp from Captain Reynolds."

"Well if ultimately we want to be notified about when the dragon's whereabouts is found, would the Gnome one be best as that is most directly related to defeating the dragon?  _Govath asks the group after reading through the options."

*Storm ponders over the postings for a moment, considering the best course of action. Speaking low enough as to not to be overheard by any of the nearby guards, he proposes to the group...*

"Govath does have a point. Gnomegarde may provide the best advantage against the dragon and perhaps we too shall find something to give us an advantage over The Stone-Cold Reavers. However, if we want to maximize our efficiency, what if we were to take a second. Let us inquire about the whereabout of the Dwarf ruins and the Gnomengarde entrance. If the Dwarf ruins are on the way, to the Gnomes, we take the Gnome contract and...*obtain* the Dwarven contract on the side."

_Skimming the board, Cain takes little interest in the contents of each contract, and more the destination. Noting the Gnomes could be found deep inside a mountain ..._

"Sure. I agree with Govath, the Gnome's technology might prove useful if a showdown with a dragon does happen upon us."
"The general idea is each party gets one job, Red. I'd be inclined to grab whatever is left over, but seeing as there are only three today, I reckon there won't be any extra."
"Also seeing as each requires reporting back to the Captain, it might not go so well. Though we could always hope that completion of these contracts are not important to him than fairness ..."

*Storm bows.* "This one is still trying to learn your customs. In Port Nyanzaru, the adventuring groups take on all that they can carry. Then perhaps we can at least stop at this ancient ruins for a resupply before heading into the mountain."

messages.content: (correction: are _more_ important)

embeds.description: "As you've been witness to," *he nods his head towards the reavers,* "competition can be fierce. And out in the wilds...the law is sometimes hard to find. I'd be more worried to find my throat slit in the mornin' than our captain's sense of fairness. But we can choose one now and stick around to see if a third group comes by to claim the last. It's all up ta you."
"Well if everyone is agreed, we take the Gnome posting, and doesn't really bother me if we stick around.  Or if some of us want to wait while the others go and grab some supplies as needed."
"Yes let us take the Gnome posting. Since this will take us below the mountains, let us be sure to be well prepared with light and rope."
_Rowan rips the gnome listing off the board and rolls it up neatly, tucking it in a pocket of his pack._
"This feels to be a good day.  So what was that you mentioned about breakfast earlier Rowan?"

"This one will need to buy a few more supplies before breakfast. How many days journey do you think this shall be? A few extra rations will be wise. Guide Rowan, point me in the direction of a general store and then I can meet up with you shortly after."
*Rowan gives the Tabaxi detailed directions to a general store known as Wynn's Wares.* "That should suit ya unless you need weapons or armour."
"Where shall I meet you after I am done?"
"_Upon checking the contents of his pack Govath grumbles to himself._  I will join you in buying supplies.  Seems I was running lower than I had thought."
"So Cain, yeh doin' ok for supplies?"

"Well Govath, shall we?"

*Storm heads off to Wynn's Wares to do a little shopping.*
"Yes, I think I have enough for a few days journey into the wilds. Hopefully these gnomes are a welcoming bunch." _he replies to Rowan.
*Before the two head off to find the general store, Rowan tells them of a bakery where they can grab a quick bite before departing on the journey.* "Meet us there, an' we're off."
"A great idea. We shall meet you there within the hour."

The road that Rowan directs you down winds around the north end of Leilon, past the eastern entrance and toward the north exit to the High Road.  You hang a left down a wide road and enter what appears to be the town’s main shopping strip - several stalls and buildings offering all manner of goods, from flowers to furniture.

Here, activity is beginning to pick up.  As the various shops open up for the day, townsfolk begin flitting back and forth, in and out of buildings, carrying their baskets of goods.

Before long, you find Wynn’s Wares, a fairly large building with its name emblazoned in old-fashioned script upon a hanging wooden sign outside the door.  Upon entering, you doubt for a moment that you’ve found the right place - the shelves are so littered with random curiosities that it’s hard to see the adventuring gear in-between.

Behind the counter at the back is an elderly Elf, who appears to be tinkering with a wind-up toy carousel.  He sets it down as he hears the bell above the door ring upon your entry.

embeds.title: Wynn
embeds.description: "Ah, well-met!  Welcome to Wynn's Wares!  What want wins me the witness of such winsome wanderers?  Whether one wishes for whistle, waterskin or whetstone, Wynn's Wares won't withhold!"

*Although Storm isn't much for shopping, he can't help but take in all the strange and obscure items that liter the shelves. He browses momentarily before hunting down the essentials for the journey. Grabbing various things such as a bedroll and rope, he pays the Elf with the remaining money he has left, barely making the cost for all the items even after selling a few odd things in his pack. Packing him into in backpack, he does another quick look around the shop.*

embeds.title: Storm of Fire makes a Perception check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (19) + 3 = `22`
*Storm looks around for anything resembling unique or complex construction, with gears, clockwork or moving mechanical components. The more unique the invention, the better!*

"_Govath wanders through several aisles looking through some of the oddities, and picking up the items that he will need for the trip.  Eventually making his way to the proprietor._  This is quite the collection of oddities you have here.  How did you come by all of them?"

embeds.title: Wynn
embeds.description: "Ah!  When wanderers, wearily weighted, wander into Wynn's Wares and wish to winnow their weighty whimsical wonders, whether working or weathered, Wynn is wont to assist.  Such wonders Wynn welds, wrenches and winds back to working - when not warmly selling wares, naturally."

As Storm looks around the shop, he sees all kinds of curiosities - toys, time-keeping devices, intricate boxes with locking mechanisms unknown to him, model gliders - but one thing that catches his eye in particular is something in the shadowy back corner, behind the desk.  A pile of curiosities is haphazardly stored there (presumably waiting for Wynn's repairs), but one object stands much taller than the others.  It's mostly covered by a white sheet, but sticking out slightly from underneath is what appears to be a life-sized humanoid arm, constructed of wood and metal, hinged at both elbow and wrist.
"Have you any creation of your own mind?  I would be interested to see another craftsman's work.  _While talking Govath places his supplies on the counter and pays for his food and bedroll_."

*Eyeing the strange contraption under the sheet, Storm inquires about it. Though this is the first shop he has been to this side of the sea, he cautiously follows ol' Wynns' style of speech as to not offend.*

"That thing tarped there, this Tabaxi thinks that tale trembles thrillingly! Tell that tsoufa, thanks!"

embeds.title: Wynn
embeds.description:
"_(To Govath):_ Wynn's while is more whittled with fixing wanderers' wonders - not Wynn's own.

_(Turning to Storm):_ Of the wonders upon which Wynn is working, the one you witness is most wrecked.  When the wanderer welcomely left it as waste, Wynn was made aware it is a Nimblewright of Waterdeep.  Woefully, Wynn's wrenching and winding has not won the working of this wonder."
"Terrible that the treasure remains tattered. This Tabaxi travels today, though thinks the talented Wynn can task this trekking traveller for help?"

embeds.title: Wynn
embeds.description: "If, while wandering, one witnesses the workings of Nimblewrights, Wynn would welcome the knowledge wholeheartedly!  Wynn wasn't aware of such wonders before the wanderer walked in with it, and knows woefully little of what winds it."

*Storm tells Wynn of their venture to Gnomengarde and that perhaps they will find someone or something that can help him repair the Nimblewright. Perusing the shop a little more, Storm finds some interesting pieces and barters with Wynn. Trading some of his belongings, Storm takes the trinkets and packs them in his bag along with all the adventuring gear he managed to purchase. Wishes Wynn luck, tells him he will visit again when he returns to Leilon and heads outside to wait for Govath.*

embeds.title: Wynn
embeds.description: "Wishing you wealth and wellness, wanderer!"

__While Storm barters for the many odd pieces, Govath continued to walk the aisles picking up, shaking and examining various contraptions.  Shortly after hearing Storm leave by the ringing of the door bell, he heads out the door and thanks Wynn for his time on the way out._

_Watching Storm and Govath leave to shop for preparations, Cain begins to feel the heat beneath the hood which full covers his head. He needed to catch some fresh air, but not here._

_Turning to Rowan, he asks_, "I suppose we should head to the bakery while we wait for the others? Get something to snack on? Or do you want to wait here and see what the Reavers will do?"
"Let's give them some space, but we can wait awhile t'see if the last job gets snatched up."

"Good idea, though the others will be expecting at the bakery. Maybe I'll go on ahead in case they arrive and you can meet us shortly?."

_He really needed to get out of the stifling hooded robe_

"Just point me in the direction and I'll head on over."
*Rowan puffs another cloud from his nostrils.* "If yeh aren't too concerned about the last job I'll show yeh the way m'self, mate." *He heads off towards the bakery.*

*Outside of Wynn's Wares, Storm sees Govath exiting the shop.*

"Govath, I hope you managed to find what you were looking for. This shop is quite a thing, many odd trinkets to be found. I do think I will be back to visit when we return. Wynn put aside a trinket for me that I cannot afford right now though I did get a few other things. I'll show you when we get to the bakery. Do you know your way there? I think I need to make a quick stop back at the Sword of Leilon. I will meet you and the others at the bakery shortly!"
"I'll find my way.  Might wander the town a little between here and there.  Do not get lost yourself."

"I shall be quick. The guide Rowan wishes to be out of town early this morning so we should not keep them waiting too long. I will be brief and will see you soon!"

*Storm of Fire scurries down the street, but heads back towards the job posting board rather than the Sword of Leilon to see what groups have gathered and what postings remain.*
_Govath sets off at a steady pace in the direction of the bakery while looking around at the various building._
*After a quick stop at the job board and a brief chat with the guards, Storm scurries off to the bakery to meet with the rest of the party, ready to being the journey.*

Cain and Rowan make it to the bakery and wait for the other two.  Storm arrives first, followed after a short while by Govath.  The four of you purchase a simple breakfast (2cp) from the female Half-Elf proprietor and eat together before preparing to depart.

"_In-between mouthfuls of breakfast Govath mentions in a quite grumble to the group._  I think it's best we try and avoid the reavers for now.  They don't exactly have the best reputation as adventuring groups go."

_Arriving to the bakery first with Rowan, Cain quickly excuses himself as he heads into the washrooms. The moment the door is closed, he tears off the hood and breaths in a deep breath of air. The oversized hood was suffocating._

"This isn't a long term solution ..." _he thinks to himself while looking into the mirror._ "But, I just need to get as far as possible first ..."

_He splashes some water onto his face, sighs and proceeds to don the hood once again and leaves to return to the sitting area_.

_Cain orders a blueberry pastry and finds Govath already at the table eating. Catching the the last of his sentence as he sits down, he replies,_ "I agree, they don't seem like a friendly bunch and right now I don't think we want to find ourselves at blows with them."

"They do seem like trouble though our paths should not cross on the way to Gnomengarde. This one did happen to see which group took the last posting. It was a group of three young looking adventurers. Pleasant looking enough and certainly less troublesome looking than our Reaver friends."

*Storm sets his Lute case down along with a now, bulging travellers backpack.*

"Wynn's Wares is also quite the establishment. You should have a look when we return, there is all sorts of strange things. I did manage to trade for a few necessities that I notice you all have."

*He proceeds to outline the adventuring gear he purchased such as a bedroll, rations, hammer, rope...*

"I also found these interesting things which I traded some of my wares from Chult for. I figure if we are to seek the Gnome's aid with this Dragon, a gifts may go a long way."

*Storm first pulls out a small wooden box carved with stars and other cosmic objects. He opens it to display a mechanical diorama. It is a model depicting Toril and the moon Selune orbiting around Sol. He winds it up and the diorama beings to move.*

*Next to that he produces a small mechanical Spider. Winding-up the mechanism hidden on underside, he places it on the table and the Spider begins to crawl.*

*Rowan let out a long enthusiastic whistle, the cigar still firmly planted between his teeth.* "Well lookit that, good find Red!" *and turning to address everyone,* "So I reckon we can kick the dust of this town?"

*Storm repacks his bags and downs his breakfast.*

"This one is ready to depart."

_Picking up the spider and examining it, Cain wonders if these are just children's toys ... but the gesture could go a long way regardless. He hands it back to Storm before standing up_.

"I'm ready as well. Rowan, how do you suggest we travel?"
"Well, s'long as nobody here is holding back on us and has a fleet of horses waiting in the town stables, I 'spose we start walkin'."
